daily_plan_req: 1. Wake up at 7:00 AM and complete morning routine 2. Head to Oak Hill College library to work on project at 9:00 AM 3. Meet with Isabella Rodriguez and Wolfgang Schulz at 2:00 PM at the community center 4. Go to Hobbs Cafe for dinner at 5:00 PM.
name: Klaus Mueller
learned: Klaus Mueller is a student at Oak Hill College studying sociology. He is passionate about social justice and loves to explore different perspectives.
currently: Status: Klaus Mueller is scheduled to meet with Isabella Rodriguez and Wolfgang Schulz on Tuesday February 14 at 2:00 PM in the community center to discuss incorporating Carlos Gomez's poetry and traditional African music into their project on gentrification. Klaus is committed to actively involving members of the Black community in the creative process and incorporating elements of traditional African music, storytelling, and folklore to authentically represent their perspectives and experiences. Klaus is excited about the collaboration and inclusive approach for the project.
lifestyle: Klaus Mueller goes to bed around 11pm, awakes up around 7am, eats dinner around 5pm.
living_area: the Ville:Dorm for Oak Hill College:Klaus Mueller's room

go to the library at Oak Hill College at 9:00 am
work on research paper until lunch at 12:00 pm
have lunch at Hobbs Cafe at 12:30 pm
continue working on research paper at the library until 4:30 pm
